prop.name: provider
prop.desc: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

prop.name: paymentDue
prop.desc: The date that payment is due.

prop.name: billingPeriod
prop.desc: The time interval used to compute the invoice.

prop.name: confirmationNumber
prop.desc: A number that confirms the given order or payment has been received.

prop.name: scheduledPaymentDate
prop.desc: The date the invoice is scheduled to be paid.

prop.name: customer
prop.desc: Party placing the order or paying the invoice.

prop.name: category
prop.desc: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

prop.name: paymentStatus
prop.desc: The status of payment; whether the invoice has been paid or not.

prop.name: broker
prop.desc: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

prop.name: referencesOrder
prop.desc: The Order(s) related to this Invoice. One or more Orders may be combined into a single Invoice.

prop.name: paymentMethod
prop.desc: The name of the credit card or other method of payment for the order.

prop.name: paymentMethodId
prop.desc: An identifier for the method of payment used (e.g. the last 4 digits of the credit card).

prop.name: minimumPaymentDue
prop.desc: The minimum payment required at this time.

prop.name: accountId
prop.desc: The identifier for the account the payment will be applied to.

prop.name: paymentDueDate
prop.desc: The date that payment is due.
